name: Triangular Fibrocartilage Complex (TFCC) Avulsion with Ulnar Impaction Syndrome
chief_complaint: I have sharp pain on the pinky side of my wrist, especially when twisting or gripping things. It's been getting worse over the past few months.
symptoms: Clicking or popping sensation with movement

lab_results.X-ray: ulnar impaction with cystic changes in lunate

prognosis: Good with surgical intervention, though full recovery may take 6-12 months. Untreated cases may lead to progressive degenerative changes.
description: Complex injury involving both traumatic avulsion of the TFCC and chronic ulnar impaction due to positive ulnar variance. The condition combines acute ligamentous injury with chronic bony overload, requiring both soft tissue and bony correction.
